Reviews.Title: A review on the actual laptop
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Good laptop! this is a good laptop with a beautiful design, strong system. With this price, you can not find another laptops like this or stronger. With 8Gb DIMM RAM and 2.4 Core-i7 processor, this machine can run almost professional programs. Quick start, fast running, display at high resolution. This laptop is suitable for both students and professionals.For a cheaper version here:B00DMMPQ3O

Reviews.Title: Good specs, bad screen
Reviews.Author: Anlaw
Reviews.Content: I am not a computer expert, so I saw this computers specs and was immediately "wowed" by them and the laptop's relatively cheap price. One thing that I ended up overlooking is that the screen on this laptop is not that great. I learned that 1366x768 is not a very good resolution for a 15.6" screen and I could tell as soon as I turned the machine on. Everything looked blurry, and although the laptop seemed just fine otherwise the poor display quality is why I made the decision to return this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Best laptop for the price.... Not to mention that it have a 4th generation Monster I7 :)
Reviews.Author: abraham
Reviews.Content: couldnt be better!  this is the first laptop that Im able to use 8hr continue on my bed or on my legs without get heat, this laptop never, never, never got heat. Really fast, I used for development (Biztalk, SQL & C#) so far the response of the laptop is great!

Reviews.Title: Very good laptop
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I was between this laptop, lenovo flex and HP envy, but for the price under $700 and the specs. I bougt this. It is fast, sound is great, no fan noise and great backlit keyboard.The brushed aluminium case feels cheap, it is brushed silver plastic, but again for the price i was expecting that. As an average user: documents, media, internet, medium gaming this laptop works perfect in every situation.Touch sceen :NOBluetooth: YES (Settings<change pc settings<bluetooth).Touchpad: Like it.Widows 8.1:  1- 10, maybe 6.Recommended: YES

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop - Glad I Got It
Reviews.Author: Enginerd
Reviews.Content: I've had this laptop for about 2 weeks now and am very impressed by it. I did a significant amount of shopping, both online and in brick and mortar stores and could not find as good a laptop at this price. the processor speed and RAM are enough for me to run AutoCAD and anything else I want at the same time with no issues. This processor should keep me in business for several years before needing more power.This is my first Win 8 machine and I was pleased to find it came with Windows 8.1 installed. I installed Classic Shell (freeware) that makes it feel more like Win 7 with a start button and now it's just like I'm used to (almost).You can find the full specs online so I won't repeat them all here but I'll state what I like, what I'm still undecided about and what I wish were done better:Likes:The processor and RAM - FAST 4th Gen i7 quad core and 8GBThe speakers/sound system is awesomeBacklit keyboard and the keys have a good solid feel to them.It's easy to turn the back lighting on the keys on & off.There's an actual button to turn off the touchpad while typing - I hate palm detection; it never works for meThe laptop is thin and light - not quite what I'd call an Ultrabook, but close.Construction feels solid, even if it's not a metal case (see undecided).I still like having a DVD drive even though I rarely use it.VGA and HDMI video outputs for near universal monitor/projector connections.SD card reader and 3 total USB ports. I have not tried the sleep and charge on the USB 2.0 port.Undecided:The case and exterior are plastic (metalized plastic for the lid) - It seems to be pretty durable but time will tell. My last 3 laptops have all been plastic and it's been fine so I shouldn't be so picky I guess.The screen is glossy and I'm used to a matte screen - still getting used to thisBattery life seems decent but have not tried this out too much yet.Could be better:Wish it had a 1080 HD+ display, but the 720 HD it has is standard in 15.6" laptops. It costs a lot more to get a 1080 HD Laptop so I can live with it.Lots of junk software comes pre-installed, but you can't avoid that unless you build your own.The battery is not removable - seems to be the way the thinner laptops are going but I'd still like to be able to just unplug it if it dies.Overall I'm very happy I got it.(Edit 2/12/14) 2 months after getting this laptop I'm still very happy that I got it.  It has proven to be very stable (I've never had it crash on me - knock on wood)and it runs anything I throw at it with no issues. Sound system is far better on this laptop than any others I've had prior.  Great laptop, great price!

Reviews.Title: Would be a fantastic laptop if it didn't come with Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: The machine is great! Very powerful & quick at every command..However, it also comes with Windows 8. I had heard the horror stories about how bad 8 is (a quick google search will show you what I mean) and just figured everybody was blowing it out of proportion. They were not. It's probably a solid system for a tablet but that's about it, the metro layout is absolute garbage on a non-touch screen computer. You have to pull and flick windows from/to corners to navigate the screen, which is very counter intuitive for any person who has used PCs in the past. If you download Microsoft's "We're sorry" Windows 8.1 update, you get a start button like past Windows setups....only it brings you back to the tiles when you click it. Right clicking does bring up actual useful options (Shut down/Task Manager/My Computer etc), but that takes some getting used to.Had I known Windows 8 was actually as bad as people had said, I would have gone the extra steps to get a system without it. You can not use your copys of Windows 7 to throw in and have it replace 8, they block that. Instead you can either pay a local PC repair shop to erase Windows 8 from the machine in favor for Windows 7, pay the $100 to Microsoft to upgrade to Windows 8 Pro and use the downgrade rights to get Windows 7 back at your finger tips. Or...just suck it up and deal with the worst PC layout to date.Trying to use such a nice machine with Windows 8 is like trying to run with your hands tied behind your back.

Reviews.Title: not bad if you get it under 700.
Reviews.Author: R. L "elak57"
Reviews.Content: 4 starts for this Toshiba if you grab one under 700 and -1 star for windows 8 and Bios lockup. can't boot from DVD or EXTERNAL players. thank you win 8 for  UEFI. you can get around that and disable it in Bios but it's pain. Toshiba tech support sucks and even on a new computer they want $$$ to help.  it's a fast computer. recpectable amount of memory and disk space. very light. repels  fingerprints.  wish it had the option to downgrade to windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Meets my needs.
Reviews.Author: JoJo
Reviews.Content: Receiving a new computer at work with an i7 processor convinced me to upgrade my own i3 laptop. With this laptop, the start-ups and shutdowns are significantly quicker. Going from 4GB to 8GB of RAM improved my web browsing speed. (It's noticeable because I only have standard DSL.) The number one reason I purchased this laptop is because of the increase in processing speed.Not crazy about Windows 8, so I downloaded "Classic Shell" for the classic Windows look. I'm not holding Windows 8 against Toshiba because that operating system comes standard with virtually every new PC.At first I was disappointed with the appearance of the graphics/display. It looked slightly washed-out compared to my older laptop. I rectified it by making adjustments with the Intel HD Graphics (Display) located in the Control Panel.The back-lit keys are awesome. The back lights are not permanently lit up. It comes on the instant you push any key, then turns off after so many seconds of inactivity. In general, the keys have a very nice feel.When I compare this to the 4 other laptops I have owned in the past: it's the fastest, the thinnest, the quietest, and stays the coolest. Also like the sleek silver look.The only downer for me is that the battery is not user-replaceable. My touchpad didn't seem to work too well, but it's moot as I prefer to use a mouse. (I disable the touchpad). Would prefer the AC connector to be on the right side instead of the left, but no biggie.So far (2 weeks), I am very please with this purchase. I use my computer for web browsing and Microsoft Office applications and it suits my needs.

Reviews.Title: Recomended
Reviews.Author: Walter Aguirre "Walter"
Reviews.Content: great product for a great price! the windows 8 didnt like to much but is a minor issue I can live with it.!!

Reviews.Title: Low Quality
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: I bought this just after Thanksgiving 2013, and began using it in the middle of December 2013. It came with Windows 8 as the default operating system. Following general consensus, I immediately upgraded to Windows 8.1. A few weeks later, my computer began lagging then completely crashing. Suspecting a virus, I enlisted the help of Norton Antivirus: no help. Several tech-savvy friends also had no solutions. Neither Best Buy nor Staples were able to find a problem either. The crashing happened more frequently, several times an hour. (By "crash" I mean it would freeze up with 100% CPU usage, not respond to any user input for at least 20 minutes, and often power itself down, or I would turn it off manually.) No error reports were ever generated. My workaround was to completely reset the operating system, and NOT upgrade to Windows 8.1. Three months later, my computer has yet to crash, thankfully. This shows me that Windows 8.1 is not compatible with this computer, and/or this computer is not capable of running contemporary software.On the hardware itself: The keyboard is comfortable to type with, and I like the placement of the arrow keys and the 10-key. However, after only 6 months of student use (mostly internet research, limited typing), several keys have already broken. Specifically, my screen-brighten button causes the computer to go into sleep mode, the dimmer button does nothing, and more recently the volume up and volume down buttons have stopped working. The computer only came with a 3 month warranty, and thus any and all repairs will be on my own dime. Replacing a keyboard is not complicated, but the fact that it is becoming necessary after 6 months causes me to lose faith in the quality of Toshiba's manufacturing. Finally, my touchpad has started tracking my fingers incorrectly, causing webpages and the mouse to jump erratically at times.I will not be buying a Toshiba again.

Reviews.Title: He didn't send the laptop that I bought
Reviews.Author: Pablo
Reviews.Content: I'm very sad and angry with this seller. He didn't send the laptop that I bought, He shipped me a more cheap laptop than I bought.I don't like and want the laptop that he shipped me. This is not right! I don't recommend him. on laptop box said s55-a5364 but inside there was a laptop Toshiba s55-5176.  I was cheated by this seller. I want to cry because I paid 730$ for one laptop that it's not that I want. the laptop don't have backlit keyboard ;( heeeelp!!

Reviews.Title: personal opinion
Reviews.Author: CIANCONE CORONADO GIOVANNI CARLO
Reviews.Content: Elegie this lapto for its versatility and price. I really like your design. Y obtained by buying recommendation of friends

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 5 Star Laptop
Reviews.Author: bobby Justice
Reviews.Content: Great Laptop! The S55-A5364 15.6-" Laptop is an excellant device with loads of features. I enjoy all it has to offer,with the ease of use and vivid display everyone will be pleased with this wonderful computer.I only have one(1) gripe i wish i had purchased one with a touch screen LOL!!!!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: paratrooper318
Reviews.Content: This unit may look good on paper, but what I received wasn't exactly what was advertised.  Remember, this is billed as a NEW unit with a Backlit Keyboard.  There is even a sticker to the right of the touchpad advertising the backlit keyboard feature.What I received did not look factory new and not even Toshiba Support could make the backlit keyboard work.  Immediately when I unpacked it, I noticed a small scratch on the display.  I could have lived with a minor scratch on the back or bottom, even though a new machine should be scratch-free, but a scratched display is unacceptable.  The "backlit keyboard" didn't work right out of the box.  In fact, it never did light up, even after a call to Toshiba support and an hour of my life I'll never get back.  This unit is not what I would call 100% NEW.  When I called Toshiba support, they told me it was a good thing I called when I did, as this unit only had 5 days of free support left from Toshiba.  Their records show it as being sold around the first of this year (This is April).  I understand things sit on the shelves sometimes before they are sold, but I don't think it's unrealistic to expect to be able to get support for a new laptop for longer than 5 days after you receive it.  And I paid for 2-day shipping to boot!The unit itself was rather sluggish and, for lack of a better word, "doggy" in operation.  The touchpad takes some getting used to, especially the "push hard with one finger to left-click and push hard with two fingers to right-click" part.  My old Dell Latitude D620 with 4GB of RAM, an ancient processor, and a cheap solid state drive is snappier than this unit was.  Do yourself a favor and buy something else.  I returned mine the same day and regret the wasted time, effort and money.

Reviews.Title: excellent computer
Reviews.Author: Mario Vargas
Reviews.Content: easy buy at amazon.excellent brand, toshiba.It could improve the priceon the other hand, computer has good features

Reviews.Title: OK Laptop
Reviews.Author: Xuming Yu
Reviews.Content: I think the laptop is OK for the price. Nothing surprised or excited. Just a normal laptop for daily usage.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: JAW85
Reviews.Content: I have had two Toshiba Satellites prior to this one but before I purchased this I tried HP.  Biggest mistake, they have the worst Tech Support.  They gave incorrect information on resetting the computer, it took me 30 minutes talking to them and they could not help.  10 minutes with Google I was able to do what they requested me to but that still did not fix the issue.  Because of poor support and a bad product they would not replace I returned it and went back to Toshiba.I am so happy that I did.  This computer is great.  Good picture, my favorite feature is probably the lit keyboard.  I work on it a lot a night with my wife asleep and it makes it much easier to work on in the dark.  I would recommend this computer to anyone in the market for one and will always purchase Toshiba in the future!

Reviews.Title: Works Fine So Far
Reviews.Author: Kerry Tatlow
Reviews.Content: I've been using the new laptop for ten days without any problems.  Fast and reliable so far.  Good value for $699.99.  I'd recommend it to anybody who needs a fast mainstream laptop (but not for intensive-graphics gaming.)

Reviews.Title: Happy.net
Reviews.Author: Misty Tyson
Reviews.Content: This computer was giving to me as a Christmas gift and what a great gift it is. Great computer very happy!

Reviews.Title: Like this laptop
Reviews.Author: Juice "JMN"
Reviews.Content: I actually like the new Windows 8.1 operating system (using mouse), the leaning curve was quick and easy, any questions on what you wanted to do with the system to do for you a quick search on the internet and issue resolved.  Even getting rid of all the unwanted apps was not much of a challenge.  The computer itself works very well however I will regret not being able to replace the battery in the future but for the $$$ I'll live with the regret.  The previous Toshiba Satellite lasted almost 8 years before passing on, not bad, hope this one does also.

Reviews.Title: I'M HAPPY WITH MY TOSHIBA LAPTOP
Reviews.Author: JORGE GONZALEZ DIAZ
Reviews.Content: Excelent laptop, mayor value for menor priceI always work with samsung, but now my choice it's this toshiba.ultimate technology, nice presentation and fast run.I recomended this laptop, it's the best of the year.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Machine, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Faith Poynton
Reviews.Content: I bought something very similar 5 years ago and it is still going strong. Please note: Amazon Prime just has UPS dump it on my doorstep the same way they would with a box of books. I was taken by surprise there. But I was home and grabbed it before the rain started.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: I bought it, it shipped, it arrived. I had no problems with anything and I got what I wanted. Plus I like the laptop. Good deal

Reviews.Title: I'm loving it!
Reviews.Author: night
Reviews.Content: This one is significantly faster than my old laptop (which uses intel centrino dual core with 4gb ram) and windows 8 really isn't that bad. U can set it directly boot to your desktop and with the pokki start menu app I managed to get the system run exactly like win7.

Reviews.Title: My review so far
Reviews.Author: michalgordon99
Reviews.Content: So far I really like the laptop. At first I hated the windows 8, especially because this laptop does not have a touch screen but I have downloaded an app called classis start 8 or something like that to make it look like windows 7. The boot up time is really fast and it is a big upgrade from my previous laptop which only had an i3 processor and 4gb ram. The backlit keyboard is also pretty nice. I have not tested it with any of the heavier programs yet since I just got it today but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Laptop
Reviews.Author: Twhite
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to me from my husband and I love it.  Light weight and nice screen.  Not a touch screen for windows 8 but not needed.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: meathead1986
Reviews.Content: picked this up nearly a week ago and after updates everything seems to be running fine. picked this up after a return on another computer. Computer has a simple, sleek design and is built extremely well (given with this pricepoint nearly everything is).The one thing that stands out above everything else on this computer is how crisp and clear the sound is. for a laptop it'll pump out some jams without sounding like headphones in a cup and with really good clarity. also some people mentioned things about the display being blurry... I haven't noticed this and the display is actually really great with super tones and great feedback on the touchscreen. Put together a Smith machine using a manual on this computer and was able to zoom in and out on detailed drawings and figure things out with the ease I wouldn't have had in a book. The keys are very quiet and very well laid out, with larger letters and numbers and all the hotkeys are very well placed and easy to see.I'd reccomend this PC so far but I'll give it a few months and post another review to let people know how things are going. as of now its a 5-star rating though!

Reviews.Title: Not happy at all it's going back blury screen (pixely)
Reviews.Author: Monster Shopper
Reviews.Content: I am a graphic designer on a budget, and thought this would work well as the specs are very similar to my other machine I am very happy with but is quite old and large. Being into graphics there is no way I would ever be able to work on this machine because it has very pixely edges on everything making things blurry. I do not know if I got a dud or if they are all this way but there is no graphic quality in order to properly edit on this machine. I am quite disappointed. It also seems to struggle under too many applications and I wasn't even running Adobe's creative suite. Not to mention that this new operating system is pretty nasty to navigate through. I did download the classic shell, which made it more user friendly but not enough for me. I think I am going MAC next.

Reviews.Title: Superb deal!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Anibarro
Reviews.Content: Superb computer deal for the price offered. Its a fast and reliable computer!Windows 8.1 might not be too atractive, but its a good option to go.Go for it

Reviews.Title: not for me, maybe for you?
Reviews.Author: Mendy Rubenfeld "DigiGuy"
Reviews.Content: High spects, yes. However it really did not deliver. I did not see great speed using this computer. The screen was poor quality in my opinion. I absolutely cannot stand Windows 8 or 8.1. I returned this device. However that's just me. The price was very good for such specs. This computer may work for you. Not what I was looking for in a relatively high end computer.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i7-4700MQ 2.4 GHz
8 GB DIMM
750 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen, Mobile Intel HD Graphics
Windows 8, 4.00-hour battery life
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba Satellite S55-A5364 15.6-Inch Laptop
